channel.title: Practice on The Practice Room
channel.description: Recent content in Practice on The Practice Room

item.title: Practicing Music Without An Instrument
item.description: Music is loud. Instruments are bulky. Traveling with instruments is difficult. These are all reasons why musicians like you and me don’t practice when they’re traveling, late at night, or without access to their instrument. But, the best musicians in the world are becoming better, even when they don’t have their instrument at their fingertips. In this article, we will go through 6 different methods on how to improve as a musician without your instrument.

item.title: Effective Jazz Practice: Insights from Dave Pollack
item.description: Original YouTube Video In a recent Q&A session, jazz musician Dave Pollack shared his expert advice on how to structure effective practice sessions. Whether you have a lot of time or just a few minutes, his tips can help you make the most of your practice. Hereâ€™s what he had to say: Q: What should a regular practice session look like for jazz? Okay, so what I always recommend is breaking up (especially jazz practicing) into three parts:
